Member Function Documentation
GetTile() GetTilegame.logic.playfield.PlayFieldViewModel game.logic.playfield.PlayFieldViewModelGetTile
ITileable game.logic.playfield.PlayFieldViewModel.GetTile (int x, int y)[inline]
Retrieves the tile located at the specified coordinates in the play field.
Parameters
x
The x-coordinate of the tile to retrieve.
y
The y-coordinate of the tile to retrieve.
Returns
An object implementing the ITileable interface representing the tile at the specified coordinates.
This method accesses the internal representation of the play field, which is organized as a two-dimensional array. It returns the tile located at the given (x, y) coordinates. The coordinates must be within the bounds of the play field. If the coordinates are out of bounds, this method may throw an exception, depending on the implementation of the underlying data structure. Ensure that the provided coordinates are valid before calling this method to avoid runtime errors.
PlaceTile() PlaceTilegame.logic.playfield.PlayFieldViewModel game.logic.playfield.PlayFieldViewModelPlaceTile
void game.logic.playfield.PlayFieldViewModel.PlaceTile (ITileable tile, int x, int y)[inline]
Places a tile at the specified coordinates in the play field.
Parameters
tile
The tile to be placed in the play field.
x
The x-coordinate where the tile will be placed.
y
The y-coordinate where the tile will be placed.
This method assigns the provided tile to the specified position in the play field, which is represented as a two-dimensional array. The coordinates x and y must be within the bounds of the play field. If the coordinates are out of bounds, this may lead to an index out of range exception. This method does not return a value as it modifies the state of the play field directly. Here is the caller graph for this function:
Update() Updategame.logic.playfield.PlayFieldViewModel game.logic.playfield.PlayFieldViewModelUpdate
void game.logic.playfield.PlayFieldViewModel.Update ( )[inline]
Updates the game state by processing events from the event queue.
This method retrieves the event queue from the service locator and checks for a specific event identified by EventId.SpawnTile. If a SpawnTileEvent is found in the queue, it invokes the delegate associated with the event to create a tile shape. The created tile shape is then placed at the specified coordinates (0, 0) in the game world. This method is typically called during the game loop to ensure that events are processed in a timely manner.
Implements gamerunner.IUpdatable. Here is the call graph for this function:
